item.title: A bill to provide for the liquidation or reliquidation of entries of certain manufacturing equipment.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

summary.text: Permits the liquidation or reliquidation of entries of certain mold press machines only if a request therefor is filed with the Bureau of Customs and Border Protection of the Department of Homeland Security, not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, that contains sufficient information to enable the Bureau of Customs and Border Protection: (1) to locate the entry; or (2) to reconstruct the entry if it cannot be located.

bill.title: A bill to provide for the liquidation or reliquidation of entries of certain mold press machines.

item.title: A bill to provide for the liquidation or reliquidation of entries of certain mold press machines.
A bill to provide for the liquidation or reliquidation of entries of certain mold press machines.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
